name: Best Buttermilk Biscuits
author: Carol Reese Hardbarger
summary: This recipe makes fluffy, light, and tasty biscuits.
ingredients: ½ cup butter-flavored shortening (such as Crisco®)
directions: Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Sift flour and baking soda together in a large bowl; cut in shortening with a knife or pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs
Make a well in the center of the mixture and stir in buttermilk until a soft ball forms
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 2 to 3 minutes
Roll dough out to a 1/2-inch-thick rectangle
Cut biscuits out with biscuit cutter and transfer to a baking sheet
Bake in preheated oven until tops are light brown and sides begin to darken, about 10 minutes
Remove biscuits to cool completely on a wire rack
